author: ROHIT MULLICK
description: Unscientific road widening by the NHAI along the Kiratpur-Manali highway has forced at least nine families to evacuate their homes in five Himachal Pradesh villages. Houses developed cracks and agricultural land began sinking due to the unstable land caused by the highway work. Residents are seeking compensation from NHAI for the damages.
title: 9 Himachal Pradesh families vacate homes due to cracks, sinking land

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Joy Taylor, recently fired from Fox Sports' 'Speak,' addresses her departure amidst an ongoing lawsuit. While denying any connection between the suit and her termination, Taylor acknowledges the significant changes at FS1. The lawsuit, filed by Noushin Faraji, alleges sexual misconduct involving Taylor, Charlie Dixon, and Emmanuel Acho, with Taylor refuting the claims.
title: Joy Taylor opens up for first time about being fired by Fox Sports & ongoing scandalous lawsuit

author: MANJU V
description: India's aviation regulator, DGCA, has issued a show-cause notice to IndiGo for allegedly using unapproved simulators to train approximately 1,700 pilots for challenging airfields like Calicut, Leh, and Kathmandu. The DGCA found that critical airfield training was conducted on non-qualified simulators, potentially violating safety regulations.
title: Dgca issues show cause notice to Indigo for using unapproved simulators for pilot training

author: ROSY SEQUEIRA
description: The Bombay High Court denied bail to a Thane resident accused of being a Bangladeshi national, emphasizing that possessing documents like Aadhaar and PAN cards doesn't automatically grant Indian citizenship. The court noted the police's allegations of illegal entry and forged documents, along with digital evidence linking him to Bangladesh. The investigation is ongoing.
title: Aadhaar, PAN, voter ID alone not enough proof of citizenship: Bombay high court

author: AMIT ANAND CHOUDHARY
description: The Supreme Court has ruled that convicts serving fixed-term life sentences, like 20 years, are automatically entitled to release upon completion of their term, without needing government remission. Justices Nagarathna and Viswanathan clarified this while ordering the release of Sukhdev Pehalwan in the Nitish Katara case.
title: Convict given fixed life for 20 yrs entitled to be freed after term: Supreme Court

author: TNN
description: A typographical error in a Madhya Pradesh High Court verdict led to a mix-up in the bail orders of a father and son, Halke and Ashok, accused of lynching a shopkeeper. Initially, Halke's lawyer filed a bail bond based on the incorrect information, leading to an order for his release.
title: Typo in high court order 'swaps' verdicts for father & son seeking bail

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Donald Trump will meet Vladimir Putin to discuss ending the Ukraine war. The meeting, requested by Putin, excludes Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Trump aims to understand how to achieve peace. Zelenskyy insists no agreement is valid without Ukraine's involvement. European allies support Ukraine's stance. Trump will share the meeting's outcome with Zelenskyy and European leaders. The meeting will be held in Alaska.
title: Zelenskyy has been sidelined from the upcoming Russia-US talks - Here's why

author: MANOJ CHAURASIA
description: Bihar's Election Commission (EC) defended its handling of electoral roll revisions, stating opposition parties' bulk objections weren't formally processed due to procedural non-compliance. While individual elector claims are being addressed, the INDIA bloc accuses the EC of bias and ignoring irregularities like voter roll deletions.
title: Opposition’s ‘bulk’ objections to SIR not entertained: Election Commission

author: LUBNA KABLY
description: Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC) is seeking public input on the future of the Express Entry system, a key pathway to Canadian permanent residency. Proposed changes include a new 'Leadership and Innovation' category prioritizing senior managers and scientists.
title: Canada charts an Express Entry reset: A new 'leadership' category - details

author: TNN
description: Punjab Police dismantled a Babbar Khalsa International (BKI) terror module, arresting two operatives and detaining three juveniles. The module, directed by foreign-based handlers and a Pak-based operative, was planning attacks before Independence Day. Authorities seized a hand grenade, pistol, and ammunition, averting further incidents after a previous liquor store attack.
title: 5 'Babbar Khalsa operatives' held; terror plot foiled, claims Punjab DGP

author: SURESH KUMAR
description: In a shocking turn of events at Madras High Court, a 14-year-old girl jumped from a corridor after a custody dispute ruling. The court ordered her to a government home, rejecting her plea to live with her grandmother in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. The girl's father had filed a habeas corpus petition, leading to her discovery in Andamans.
title: Chennai: Teen in custody row jumps off 1st floor after high court order

author: TNN
title: India rejects jurisdiction of international court on water treaty

author: TNN
title: Monsoon session: Om Birla forms panel to inquire into grounds for Justice Varma's removal

author: BHARTI JAIN
description: The Home Ministry has amended the Citizenship Act, making OCI cardholders liable for cancellation if sentenced to at least two years in jail. The updated rules also allow for cancellation if an OCI cardholder is chargesheeted for offenses punishable with seven years or more imprisonment.
title: Overseas citizens of India card can be cancelled if jailed for over 2 yrs: MHA

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Patrick Mahomes' mother, Randi, recently addressed false rumors circulating about her health, including a fabricated report of her death. This occurred after she expressed frustration about not being able to watch a preseason game.
title: Patrick Mahomes’ mother Randi Mahomes breaks her silence on health rumors after a heartbreaking year

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: Magnesium, vital for various bodily functions, is gaining recognition. Dr. Amy Shah highlights its benefits for brain health, energy, muscle function, and more. While supplements are popular, she emphasizes prioritizing dietary sources like nuts, seeds, and leafy greens. Different magnesium types cater to specific needs, such as sleep, brain function, or heart health.

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: President Zelenskyy has staunchly refused ceding Donbas to Russia, asserting it would incite further aggression and a potential third war. He voiced concerns over potential demands for Ukrainian withdrawal during upcoming peace talks. While Trump aims to mediate, Zelenskyy insists on security guarantees and EU involvement, dismissing territorial concessions without assurances of lasting peace and sovereignty.

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: A recent study reveals the importance of vitamin K₁ for heart health. Higher intake of vitamin K₁ is linked to healthier arteries. It may also reduce the risk of cardiovascular death. The study suggests that consuming leafy greens daily is beneficial. It helps in maintaining vascular health. Researchers recommend further studies. They want to confirm these findings.
title: This vitamin can cut down heart disease risk by 43%, daily consumption is the key

author: TNN
description: The Rajasthan High Court has supported a visually impaired MBBS student's plea to continue her studies, emphasizing that vision extends beyond eyesight. The court has instructed medical authorities to form an expert panel to evaluate Ankita Singodia's capabilities and suggest ways to help her finish the course after she lost her vision in an accident.
title: HC panel to review if student who lost eye sight in accident can resume medical studies

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Anthony Edwards is embroiled in a contentious legal battle with his ex-girlfriend, Ayesha Howard, following the birth of their daughter in October 2024. Howard is demanding a $500,000 settlement and a public apology, alleging that Edwards wants nothing to do with their child. The situation has sparked outrage among fans, with many criticizing both Edwards' actions and Howard's demands.
title: 'He did this to himself': Fans slam Anthony Edwards as Ayesha Howard pushes for $500K payout, public apology

This upbringing instilled in her the importance of shared meals, which now guides her parenting and community work through the Eat.Learn.Play. Foundation, providing food, education, and safe play spaces for children in Oakland.

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Amid escalating tensions, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced that Palestinians in Gaza would be allowed to leave as the military prepares for a broader offensive. This option, according to Netanyahu, aims to provide safe passage from combat zones, not forced expulsion. His remarks follow previous controversial suggestions regarding resettlement, drawing criticism reminiscent of the 1948 “Nakba.

description: The J&K police's SIA raided eight locations in Srinagar, including Yasin Malik's residence, concerning the 1990 murder of Sarla Bhatt, a Kashmiri Pandit hospital employee. This action follows LG Manoj Sinha's commitment to reinvestigate terror killings.
title: Raids at JKLF chief’s home over 1990 murder of Pandit woman

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: A growing number of Indian professionals on H-1B visas in the US face unexpected deportation threats post-layoff, even within the 60-day grace period. A recent survey reveals that 16% have received a Notice to Appear (NTA) shortly after job loss, prompting concerns about a potential permanent US ban.

author: ABHINAV KAUSTUBH
description: Perplexity, an AI search startup, has made a bold $34.5 billion all-cash offer to acquire Google's Chrome browser, aiming to challenge Google's search dominance. This move comes as Google faces antitrust pressure to divest Chrome. Perplexity pledges significant investment in Chrome's development and open-source nature, while maintaining user choice and continuity.
title: Aravind Srinivas' Perplexity, itself valued at $18 billion, makes a $34.5 billion all-cash offer to buy Google Chrome

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Suresh Raina has been summoned by the Enforcement Directorate for questioning in the 1xBet case, joining a growing list of celebrities under investigation for promoting illegal betting platforms. Actor Rana Daggubati recently appeared before the ED, while several other actors have been booked by Telangana Police for alleged links to online betting promotions.
title: ED summons Suresh Raina in connection with betting case

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Green Bay Packers' quarterback Jordan Love will undergo a minor thumb procedure this week, but it's not expected to impact his availability for the regular-season opener. The injury, sustained during a preseason game against the Jets, involves his non-throwing hand. The Packers are confident Love will return to practice next week, with no long-term concerns anticipated.
title: Jordan Love Injury: Packers QB to undergo thumb surgery

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: The tech feud between Elon Musk and Sam Altman intensifies as Musk threatens legal action against Apple over App Store rankings, alleging bias towards OpenAI's ChatGPT. Altman retaliates, accusing Musk of manipulating Twitter (X) to favor his companies and suppress rivals. This public spat highlights the growing rivalry between the two tech titans and their competing AI ventures.

description: The Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas refutes concerns regarding E20 fuel's performance and safety, dismissing claims of significant fuel efficiency loss and insurance issues as unfounded. The ministry emphasizes E20's benefits, including improved acceleration, reduced emissions, and enhanced engine performance. It also highlights the program's economic and environmental advantages.

description: Marc Andreessen predicts a revolutionary device will surpass smartphones, potentially creating the next Apple. Companies are actively exploring AI, AR, and wearable technologies to usher in a hands-free, immersive future of personal computing.

description: President Michael D. Higgins of Ireland has strongly denounced recent violent attacks against the Indian community, emphasizing that such actions contradict Irish values. description: Education Secretary Linda McMahon has launched a nationwide tour to promote returning control of education to states, beginning in Louisiana, which has shown notable literacy improvements. The tour highlights local decision-making and resource sharing, amid efforts by President Trump to dismantle the US Department of Education. McMahon addresses concerns over special education funding and emphasises state flexibility, while legal and congressional challenges continue over the department’s future.

description: Elon Musk and Sam Altman's ongoing feud reignited on X after Musk accused Apple of favoring OpenAI in the App Store, prompting Altman to retort with allegations of Musk manipulating X for personal gain.

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Minta Devi from Bihar has criticized opposition MPs for using her name in a protest against the Election Commission's voter roll revision. INDIA bloc leaders wore T-shirts with her name and a claimed age of 124, which she disputes. Devi questions their motives and denies any contact from the administration regarding the alleged discrepancy.

description: Donald Trump has launched a scathing attack on Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, criticizing his handling of interest rates and the escalating costs of the Fed headquarters renovation. Trump accused Powell of incompetence and demanded immediate rate cuts to stimulate the economy.

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: India is gearing up to celebrate its 79th Independence Day on August 15, 2025, commemorating freedom from British rule. The celebrations will serve as a reminder of the sacrifices made by freedom fighters and the importance of unity, self-sufficiency, and national pride.

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: AB de Villiers criticized IPL franchises for missing Dewald Brevis in the auction after his explosive 125* against Australia. Brevis's record-breaking innings, surpassing Faf du Plessis's previous best, powered South Africa to a 53-run victory, leveling the T20I series. Australia's sloppy fielding and Brevis's dominance against spinners proved decisive, despite Tim David's brief resistance.

description: MS Dhoni enjoys a huge fan following. Recently, fans welcomed him with mobile flashlights. Dhoni led Chennai Super Kings (CSK) to five IPL titles and two Champions League T20 titles. description: Shubman Gill has etched his name in cricket history by securing his fourth ICC Player of the Month award, a feat unmatched by any other male cricketer. description: Rahul Gandhi has alleged vote theft in 48 Lok Sabha constituencies, including Bengaluru Central, claiming irregularities similar to those previously flagged. Congress sources indicate that the party plans to release details about these seats in phases.

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Following criticism over GPT-5's rollout, Sam Altman pledges upgrades for ChatGPT users, addressing concerns about capability downgrades and restrictive conversational styles. OpenAI plans to boost capacity, add model choice flexibility, and refine GPT-5's style to be more engaging. author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Supreme Court is reviewing concerns about potential voter disenfranchisement in Bihar's electoral roll revision. The court highlighted a "trust deficit" between the Election Commission and the opposition, addressing arguments about excluded voters and document requirements. The court warned it might intervene if mass exclusion is proven, with the final roll due September 30.

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Independence Day will witness a major box office clash between Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' and Hrithik Roshan's 'War 2'. 'War 2', part of YRF's Spy Universe, faces high expectations after 'Tiger 3's average performance. Ticket prices have surged, with some exceeding Rs 2,000. 'War 2' currently lags behind 'Coolie' in advance sales, having collected Rs 4.71 crore so far.

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis highlights AI inconsistency as a major hurdle to achieving Artificial General Intelligence (AGI). While AI excels in complex tasks, it falters in simpler ones, a problem that cannot be solved by merely increasing data and computing power.

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: The DGCA has issued a show cause notice to IndiGo regarding alleged lapses in simulator training for approximately 1,700 pilots. The regulator found that IndiGo conducted critical airfield training on simulators unqualified for high-risk airports like Calicut, Leh, and Kathmandu. IndiGo is reviewing the notice and has committed to upholding the highest safety and compliance standards.

description: Indian Railways is poised to launch its first hydrogen-powered train, marking a significant stride towards eco-friendly transportation. The inaugural service will run between Jind and Sonipat in Haryana, positioning India among the leading nations adopting hydrogen technology.

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Indian government has announced that Overseas Citizen of India (OCI) cardholders could have their registration cancelled if they are convicted and sentenced to imprisonment for two years or more. The OCI card can also be revoked if they are charge-sheeted for an offense that carries a potential jail term of seven years or more, according to a recent notification.
title: OCI rules tightened: Citizenship holders may lose status if convicted for 2 years

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: The Parliament approved the New Income Tax Bill, 2025, replacing the Income Tax Act, 1961, with the Rajya Sabha's approval. The bill aims to simplify tax procedures, reduce compliance burdens, and modernise outdated provisions. Sitharaman highlighted the bill's simplified language and incorporated recommendations from the Parliamentary Select Committee, while criticising the opposition's absence during debates.
title: Parliament passes new Income Tax Bill: Rajya Sabha clears it by voice vote

description: In a recent GQ cover story, Travis Kelce opened up about his relationship with Taylor Swift, highlighting how she keeps him grounded amidst NFL fame. description: Dewald Brevis, also known as 'Baby AB', showcased an amazing performance in the second T20I. He scored an unbeaten 125 off 56 balls against Australia. This helped South Africa reach 218/7. Brevis's innings included a variety of shots. He is also a leg-spinner. He dreams of playing for Royal Challengers Bangalore with Virat Kohli in the IPL.
title: 125* in 56 balls! 'Baby AB' Brevis steals the show during T20I - Watch

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Mahendra Singh Dhoni's decade-old defamation case is finally heading to trial, as the Madras High Court has ordered proceedings to begin. Dhoni filed a Rs 100 crore suit against Zee Media and others, accusing them of falsely linking him to the IPL betting scandal. He will be available for examination, seeking to clear his name from baseless allegations.

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Apple's iPhone 17 may see a price increase. Tariffs and potential storage upgrades are factors. The Pro model might start at 256GB. Buyers are watching closely.

description: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan met President Trump after criticism over China ties. Intel issued a statement affirming commitment to US technology leadership. Trump described the meeting as "very interesting." Discussions will continue next week. This follows concerns raised about Tan's past business relationships. Intel seeks to protect federal funding for domestic manufacturing. Tan assumed Intel's leadership in March.
title: Intel issues statement on CEO's meeting with Trump after he asked for his resignation

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Dewald Brevis, the Chennai Super Kings batsman, exploded with an unbeaten 125 off 56 balls against Australia in the second T20I at Marrara Cricket Ground. His record-breaking innings, featuring 12 fours and eight sixes, propelled South Africa to their highest T20I total against Australia, 218 for seven. Brevis's century, reached in just 41 balls, is the second-fastest for South Africa.
title: Record-breaker! Brevis shatters multiple T20I milestones in one match

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: P T Usha, President of the Indian Olympic Association, strongly supports the National Sports Governance Bill, emphasizing its potential to revolutionize Indian sports administration by introducing transparency and accountability. Usha highlighted the bill's key provisions, including the establishment of a National Sports Board and a National Sports Tribunal.
title: Sports Bill will end stagnation; bring in transparency: PT Usha

description: Taylor Swift revealed her upcoming 12th album, 'The Life of a Showgirl,' on the New Heights podcast hosted by the Kelce brothers. Jason Kelce's changed hair color also grabbed attention, diverting from the album news.

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: A recent USCIS policy change, effective August 15, 2025, regarding CSPA age calculation is causing anxiety among Indian families on employment-based visas. The new rule uses the Final Action Dates chart, potentially causing children to 'age out' of green card eligibility. Experts warn this disproportionately affects Indian children who have grown up in the US.
title: H-1B children may lose Green Card: New US immigration rules create panic; read notice

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Supreme Court has provided temporary relief to owners of older vehicles in Delhi-NCR. An interim order protects owners of diesel vehicles over 10 years old and petrol vehicles over 15 years old from coercive action.

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: OpenAI's GPT-5 launch poses a threat to India's IT sector, potentially causing a 2-3% revenue decline due to enhanced AI coding capabilities. While AI improves productivity and shifts billing models, firms face challenges adapting to outcome-based pricing. Experts predict short-term pain but long-term gains as new AI opportunities emerge, requiring IT firms to overhaul delivery models.

description: Retail inflation has plummeted to a notable 1.55% in July 2025, marking an eight-year low since June 2017. A significant drop in food prices, with the Consumer Food Price Index at -1.76%, contributed to this decline.

description: Shubman Gill has been crowned ICC Men's Player of the Month for July 2025 following his stellar performance in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy. As India's Test captain, Gill amassed 567 runs at an impressive average of 94.50, including a double century and two centuries. His remarkable Edgbaston innings featured a match total of 430 runs, contributing significantly to India's historic victory.

The court's order mandates immediate capture and relocation, with strict measures against obstruction, aiming to create stray dog-free localities.

description: China is advising domestic companies to avoid using Nvidia's H20 chips. This directive impacts government projects and challenges Nvidia and AMD's revenue recovery. Donald Trump calls the H20 chip obsolete.

description: Since his 2018 Test debut, Jasprit Bumrah’s career has been plagued by recurring back injuries, beginning with a stress fracture in 2019. The problem resurfaced in 2022, forcing multiple long layoffs, surgery in 2023, and missed major tournaments. description: New Income Tax Bill 2025: The Lok Sabha has passed the New Income Tax Bill 2025, a major overhaul aimed at simplifying tax procedures for individuals and corporations. The revised bill, incorporating recommendations from a Parliamentary Select Committee, reduces text volume, streamlines the taxation timeline, and clarifies provisions for refunds and deductions.

title: Vote 'chori' row: Oppn protests SIR; MPs wear '124-yr-old Minta Devi' T-shirts

author: TIMESOFINDIA.COM
description: Israel's Ambassador to India, Reuven Azar, strongly criticised Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra for her condemnation of the Israeli strike that killed Al Jazeera journalists, labeling her remarks as deceitful. Azar defended Israel's actions, stating they targeted Hamas terrorists and accused the group of using civilians as shields. Gandhi Vadra had accused Israel of committing genocide and criticized the Indian government's silence on the matter.
title: 'Don't buy Hamas numbers': Israeli envoy to Priyanka on 'murder' of journalists

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Pappu Singh Chauhan, a Samajwadi Party leader, was expelled for engaging in "anti-party" activities following an FIR against him and others for attempting to vandalize a 200-year-old mausoleum in Fatehpur. Hindu right-wing members, claiming the site as a temple, created a disturbance.
title: Fatehpur mausoleum row: SP expels Pappu Chauhan for 'anti-party activities'

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Ambati Rayudu shared an anecdote about MS Dhoni's leadership at CSK, recalling how Dhoni cautioned him against losing his cool and arguing with umpires to avoid Fair Play point deductions. Ironically, Rayudu revealed that Dhoni himself once stepped onto the field during a tense match when CSK was facing defeat.
title: MS Dhoni's secret to staying cool: 'Like a tin roof ... '

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Elon Musk has accused Apple of anti-competitive practices within its App Store, specifically favoring OpenAI's ChatGPT. He claims Apple is making it impossible for other AI companies, including his own xAI, to achieve top rankings. Musk threatens legal action, citing an antitrust violation and questioning the exclusion of Grok and X from Apple's "Must-Have Apps" section.
title: Musk vs Apple: Elon complains; says Cook-led tech giant is behaving in a manner that…

author: TOI SCIENCE DESK
description: NASA has shared new details about 3I/ATLAS. It is an interstellar object moving at 209,000 km/h. Hubble images show it is smaller than thought, about 5.6 km wide. It is a comet with a glowing tail. Scientists estimate it is eight billion years old. It poses no threat to Earth. NASA uses telescopes to study it.
title: Nasa teases major discovery: Mystery object speeds through solar system

author: TNN
description: Lyricist Vairamuthu's recent remarks on Lord Ram, claiming he was 'out of his mind' after separating from Sita, have ignited controversy in Tamil Nadu. Vairamuthu's comments, made at a Kambar Kazhagam event, drew sharp criticism from TN BJP President Nainar Nagenthran, who deemed them 'anti-Hindu'.
title: 'Ram was out of his mind': Tamil poet Vairamuthi's remarks sparks row

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Vivo has launched the V60 in India, a mid-range smartphone featuring an FHD+ display and powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 7 Gen 4 chipset. It boasts a 6,500 mAh battery, IP68/IP69 dust and water resistance, and a versatile camera system with a 50MP main lens.
title: Vivo V60 launched in India: Price, specs and more

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: KN Rajanna was removed from his cabinet post. This followed his criticism of Rahul Gandhi. Supporters protested across Karnataka. One person reportedly attempted self-immolation. Siddaramaiah removed Rajanna after Congress high command directive. DK Shivakumar raised concerns about Rajanna's statements. Rajanna questioned Rahul Gandhi's vote theft allegations. BJP MLA R Ashoka commented on the situation.
title: 'Vote chori' row: Thousands protest KN Rajanna’s removal from cabinet

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Elon Musk's AI chatbot, Grok, faced a brief suspension from X, sparking controversy after it attributed the removal to comments about Israel's actions in Gaza, citing ICJ rulings and UN reports. Musk dismissed this, attributing the suspension to a "dumb error.
title: Grok suspended over Gaza comments? Musk calls it ‘dumb error’

author: TOI SCIENCE DESK
description: Blue Origin now accepts cryptocurrency, including Bitcoin and Ethereum, for its New Shepard space tourism flights, partnering with Shift4 Payments for secure transactions. This move allows customers to book flights with digital currencies, requiring a $150,000 deposit. The initiative aims to broaden accessibility and integrate crypto into the luxury space travel market, offering an 11-minute suborbital experience.
title: ‘Pay in Bitcoin’: Blue Origin opens crypto bookings; Bezos bets on digital space tourism

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Supreme Court is currently reviewing petitions challenging the Election Commission's decision to conduct a Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls in Bihar. Allegations of discrepancies, such as inaccuracies in voter status, have been raised by petitioners.
title: ‘Bound to have defects’: EC defends Bihar voter roll exercise; SC seeks details

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: President Trump, during a press conference announcing the federalization of Washington, DC, dismissed a reporter's request for a larger press briefing room, jokingly stating he didn't want the press to be comfortable. This remark drew laughter from officials and reporters present. Trump also declared "Liberation Day in DC," vowing to eliminate crime and improve the capital.
title: 'Don't want you to be comfortable': Did Trump just roast the press? Watch video

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Pakistan's army chief, General Asim Munir, sparked controversy during his US visit by making anti-India remarks, including a threat to target Reliance's Jamnagar refinery. India strongly condemned Munir's "nuclear sabre-rattling" and questioned the safety of Pakistan's nuclear arsenal. Despite Pakistan's threats, India's military strength surpasses Pakistan's, with a larger active military and a growing nuclear arsenal.
title: 'If we are going down ...': Pak threatens to target RIL’s refinery; shows intent to hit India’s eco assets

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Supreme Court of India has mandated the immediate release of convicts across all states and union territories who have completed their court-mandated sentences, provided they are not implicated in other cases. This directive follows the court's concern about prisoners being detained beyond their sentence terms. The order was issued during the case of Sukhdev Yadav, convicted in the Nitish Katara murder, who finished his 20-year sentence in March.
title: Nitish Katara murder case: SC rules no jail beyond fixed term

author: PTI
description: AGNIT Semiconductors, India's pioneering GaN semiconductor startup incubated at IISc, has received the Deep Tech Emerge 50 Award 2025 by NASSCOM. This award recognizes AGNIT's efforts in building a vertically integrated GaN semiconductor ecosystem. With support from IISc and MeitY, AGNIT aims to strengthen India's position in the global semiconductor value chain.
title: ‘Remarkable claim’: Sam Altman accuses Elon Musk of manipulating X; feud over Apple’s App Store

author: TNN
description: Animal welfare activists are up in arms against a recent Supreme Court order mandating the relocation of stray dogs, citing violations of the Animal Birth Control Rules, 2023. They emphasize the absence of government-run dog shelters in Delhi-NCR and the impracticality of mass relocation without proper census data.
title: ‘Unscientific and inhumane': Activists say SC order goes against govt's 2023 rule

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Bhutto issues warning to India over Indus; follows Munir’s N-threat

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: India is engaged in trade discussions with the US, reaffirming its commitment to resolving pending matters through dialogue, while firmly maintaining certain non-negotiable positions. Despite challenges in Indo-US trade relations, India is actively diversifying its export strategies, leveraging existing trade agreements and exploring new partnerships with countries like EFTA and the UK.
title: 'Can’t cross some red lines': Govt officials on India-US trade talks

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: The public feud between OpenAI's Sam Altman and Tesla's Elon Musk escalates as Altman accuses Musk of manipulating X for personal gain after Musk alleged Apple's anti-competitive behavior favoring OpenAI's ChatGPT in the App Store rankings. This clash highlights the complex history between the two tech leaders, stemming from Musk's early involvement with OpenAI.
title: Elon Musk accuses Apple: Sam Altman hits back; says, This is a remarkable claim given what…

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Georgina Rodríguez, now engaged to Cristiano Ronaldo, has amassed a $10 million fortune through modelling, reality TV, and entrepreneurial ventures. Their engagement was announced on August 11 on Instagram. While Ronaldo boasts a billion-dollar net worth, safeguards are reportedly in place: Rodríguez would receive a substantial monthly pension and Ronaldo's Madrid mansion if they separate.
title: Football: What is Georgina Rodriguez's net worth? How much will Ronaldo have to pay if they split?

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: State Bank of India has ceased trade and foreign currency dealings with Nayara Energy due to potential US sanctions, prioritizing compliance with international rules. This decision, made after recent US tariff hikes and EU sanctions, impacts Nayara's international transactions. Nayara is now seeking alternative arrangements with domestic institutions like UCO Bank to navigate these challenges.
title: Fresh trouble for Nayara Energy: SBI stops trade & forex transactions

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has formed a three-member committee to probe allegations against Justice Yashwant Varma related to a “cash-at-home” controversy. The panel includes senior advocate P.V. Acharya, Justice Aravind Kumar of the Supreme Court, and Madras High Court Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava.
title: 'Process of removal should begin': Panel formed to probe Justice Varma cash row

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Rahul Gandhi opposed the Supreme Court's order on relocating stray dogs. He called it a step back from humane policies. The court directed that Delhi-NCR localities should be free of stray dogs. It also ordered no captured dogs to be released back. The court warned against obstructing the capture drive. Police detained animal rights activists protesting the decision at India Gate.
title: 'Public safety, animal welfare go hand in hand': Rahul on SC's stray dog order

author: KALYAN DAS AND GAURAV TALWAR
description: A temporary lake near Harsil, formed after the Dharali flash flood, poses a threat to downstream areas. Authorities are working to drain the lake safely. Geologists are assessing the lake's stability. SDRF personnel are clearing obstructions. The Army is overseeing operations. Road restoration is hampered by the lake and ongoing rain. NDMA has ordered constant surveillance and safe water release.
title: Uttarakhand flash flood aftermath: Temporary lake formed in Harsil poses new risk

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: In a surprising turn of events, Donald Trump reversed his stance on Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan after a White House meeting. This followed Trump's earlier demand for Tan's resignation due to concerns over his China connections. Tan's visit, accompanied by key cabinet members, aimed to address "misinformation" and safeguard Intel's CHIPS Act funding amid growing competition and geopolitical tensions.
title: ‘Amazing story’: Trump praises Intel CEO days after urging resignation; Tan’s DC dash pays off

author: TNN
description: A man had a close brush with death inside Bandipur Tiger Reserve when he was attacked by a tusker. Basavaraj, a resident of Nanjangud, alighted from his vehicle near Kekkanahalla and was charged by the elephant, which was guarding its calf. The incident, captured on video, shows the tusker knocking Basavaraj down and trampling him.
title: Bandipur: 50-year-old man alights from car to take elephant's pic, trampled

author: TIMESOFINDIA.COM
description: The debate continues over electric heavy-duty trucks as Bill Gates expresses skepticism, while Elon Musk champions Tesla's Semi, slated for volume production in 2026. Challenges remain regarding charging infrastructure, battery weight, and range, but positive momentum exists with increasing deployments and favorable policies. Hydrogen and synthetic fuels may complement batteries for demanding applications.
title: Bill Gates doubts electric trucks; Elon Musk says Tesla Semi by 2026

author: TOI TECH DESK
description: Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI, is worried about users getting too attached to AI models. People are using AI like ChatGPT for therapy and life coaching. Altman thinks this is mostly good, but warns about risks. He wants to balance helping users with keeping them safe. Altman imagines a future where AI helps people make big decisions.
title: ‘Digital spouse’ fears: Altman warns of deep AI bonds; calls for balance in GPT era

author: TNN
description: The Supreme Court has mandated the removal of stray dogs in Delhi-NCR, directing their confinement to shelters. Various Indian cities employ different strategies, including sterilization programs, designated feeding zones, and compensation for bite victims. The Netherlands eradicated its stray dog issue through comprehensive measures like sterilization, strict animal welfare laws, and promoting adoption.
title: How Indian cities tackle stray dog menace; Netherlands ended it with 'benchmark model'

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Canada's Conservative Party is pressing Prime Minister Mark Carney to classify the Lawrence Bishnoi gang as a terrorist entity following a surge in violent incidents and extortion attempts impacting South Asian communities in British Columbia, Alberta, and Ontario. Allegedly linked to organized crime, the gang has claimed responsibility for shootings, including attacks on Kapil Sharma's café.
title: 'Freeze their assets': Canada’s opposition seeks terror tag for Bishnoi gang

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices remain range-bound, influenced by US economic data, US-China trade relations, and US-Russia talks. Spot gold closed up 1.1% at $3397, but later declined to $3,345 amid a stronger dollar and uncertainty over trade. Investors should watch for support levels at $3,310 and $3,292, with resistance at $3,375 and $3,410.
title: Gold price prediction: Where are rates headed today? Here’s the outlook

author: TOI CITY DESK
description: The State Investigation Agency (SIA) conducted raids in central Kashmir, targeting former members of the banned JKLF, as part of their investigation into the 1990 murder of Sarla Bhat, a Kashmiri Pandit woman. Bhat disappeared from her hostel in April 1990, and her body was later discovered in Srinagar.
title: Kashmiri Pandits' exodus: Raids at 8 locations over 1990 murder of Sarla Bhat

author: TOI NEWS DESK
title: Mid-air scare: Fire erupts on cargo flight engine in Chennai during landing

author: TOI Education
description: The NEET PG 2025 results are expected by September 3, 2025, as announced by the National Board of Examinations in Medical Sciences (NBEMS). Candidates can check their scorecards on the official NBEMS website using their registration details. The exam held on August 3 is a crucial step for admission to postgraduate medical courses. Stay updated for counselling and admission details.
title: NEET PG 2025 result soon: Tentative release date; step-by-step guide to download scorecards

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra condemned the Israeli strike that killed five Al Jazeera journalists, labeling it a "cold-blooded murder." She lauded the reporters' dedication to truth, accusing Israel of silencing them before a planned Gaza offensive. Israel has long accused Al Jazeera of being a Hamas mouthpiece, a claim the network denies.
title: Priyanka condemns Israel for 'cold-blooded murder' of Al Jazeera reporters

author: SOUMITRA BOSE
description: Amit Yadav, a construction labourer, tragically carried his wife's body on his motorcycle for 80km after a hit-and-run accident on the Nagpur-Jabalpur highway. Amidst heavy rain and a police chase, Amit sought help after the accident in a remote area of Pench tiger reserve.
title: 'Tied her to bike with her dupatta': Man who rode 80km in rain with wife's body

author: TOI SCIENCE DESK
description: A groundbreaking study unveils 117-million-year-old mud waves beneath the Atlantic, reshaping our understanding of its formation. These massive structures, sculpted by ancient underwater avalanches, indicate the Atlantic Ocean connected earlier than previously thought. This discovery provides insights into Cretaceous climate shifts and tectonic movements, offering crucial data for modern geology and climate science.
title: 117-million-year-old mud waves study: Atlantic’s birth revealed; key findings

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Aakash Chopra believes Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli erred by retiring from Test cricket, suggesting their ODI careers might also be nearing an end. He argues that ODIs offer less pressure and fewer opportunities to stay motivated compared to the challenges and consistent engagement provided by Test cricket.
title: Chopra on Rohit & Kohli: ‘Tests toughest, ODIs easiest – 'Said goodbye to wrong format’'

author: TNN
description: In Bengaluru, a nursing student's late-night visit turned violent when a dispute with the family's domestic help escalated. The maid, G Lalita, attacked Sushmita with a machete while she slept, following an argument about household chores. Sushmita was severely injured and later sought help, leading to Lalita's arrest in Kolar for attempted murder.
title: Domestic help attacks nursing student with machete for commenting on shoddy work

author: TOI LIFESTYLE DESK
description: A man seeking a healthier diet consulted ChatGPT for a salt alternative and was advised to use sodium bromide. After three months, he landed in the emergency department with severe psychiatric symptoms, later diagnosed as bromism. This case highlights the potential dangers of AI-generated health advice and the importance of critical evaluation.
title: Man consults ChatGPT for diet advice; later diagnosed with bromide intoxication

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Michael Rubin, a former Pentagon official, has strongly criticized Pakistan's army chief, General Asim Munir, labeling him "Osama bin Laden in a suit" after controversial remarks made on American soil. Munir allegedly threatened to destroy Indian dams and warned of global consequences if Pakistan were to fail, raising concerns about the security of its nuclear arsenal.
title: 'Osama in a suit': Ex-US official slams Asim Munir; calls Trump's India stance 'wrong'

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: US President Trump stated that Hamas is unlikely to release hostages without altered circumstances, stopping short of fully endorsing Israel's Gaza City plan. He stressed the difficulty of securing the hostages, advocating increased military pressure. Netanyahu's office confirmed discussions about taking control of Hamas strongholds for hostage release and Hamas's defeat.
title: ‘Remember Oct 7’: Trump backs Israel plan after 'a good call' with Netanyahu

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened flat in trade on Tuesday. While Nifty50 was below 24,600, BSE Sensex was near 80,500.
title: Stock market today: Nifty50 below 24,600; BSE Sensex down around 100 points

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A Socata TBM 700 turboprop, carrying four individuals, crashed into a parked aircraft while landing at Kalispell City Airport in Montana. The collision ignited a fire that spread to a grassy area, affecting several aircraft. The pilot and passengers evacuated the plane, with two passengers sustaining minor injuries treated at the airport.
title: Watch: Plane carrying 4 crashes at Montana airport

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Bodhana Sivanandan, a 10-year-old chess prodigy from Harrow, has made history as the youngest female player to defeat a grandmaster, surpassing Carissa Yip's previous record. She achieved this remarkable feat at the 2025 British Chess Championships in Liverpool, defeating Grandmaster Peter Wells.
title: Youngest ever! 10-year-old shocks Grandmaster, sets historic chess record

author: NITASHA NATU
description: In Dahisar (E), tragedy struck as an 11-year-old boy, Mahesh Jadhav, died after falling from the sixth tier of a Dahi Handi pyramid during practice. The incident occurred before Janmashtami, leading to an FIR against the mandal president for negligence, as children under 14 are prohibited from participating. Jadhav's family, migrant labourers from Karnataka, mourns the loss.
title: Mumbai tragedy: 11-year-old dies after fall from sixth-tier Dahi Handi pyramid

author: RAJIV KALKOD
description: A gruesome murder in Tumakuru district was solved after police discovered a dismembered body scattered across multiple locations. The victim, Lakshmidevamma, was allegedly killed by her son-in-law, Dr. Ramachandraiah, who suspected her of interfering in his marriage and pressuring his daughter.
title: Body parts found in 19 locations: Woman strangled, limbs cut, dumped by dentist, aides

author: TANUJ LAKHINA
description: India’s 2-2 draw in the inaugural Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy was a series of high drama, spectacular comebacks, and glaring missed opportunities. Shubman Gill’s young side matched England punch for punch but faltered in the fundamentals — from dropped catches to inconsistent bowling — leaving what could have been a historic series win just out of reach.
title: IND vs ENG: When history knocked, India left the door ajar

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Donald Trump claimed that US tariffs on India for purchasing Russian oil significantly impacted Moscow's economy, highlighting a 50% duty on Delhi. He stated that Russia's economy is struggling due to global pressures and the conflict. Trump mentioned a potential meeting with Russia to discuss resolution, noting European leaders' desire to end the conflict and focus on their own economies.
title: 'Not doing well': Trump calls tariffs on India over Russian oil 'big blow' to Moscow

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Phone number mix-ups create problems for cricketers. A man in Chhattisgarh got Rajat Patidar's old number. He then received calls from Virat Kohli and AB de Villiers. R Ashwin also shared his experience. Someone impersonated Devon Conway and asked for Kohli's number. Ashwin tested the person and found out it was a fake account. These incidents highlight impersonation risks.
title: R Ashwin falls victim to Virat Kohli number scam — Here’s what happened

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: In a tragic incident in Austin, a gunman opened fire in a Target parking lot, resulting in three fatalities. The suspect, described as a man in his 30s with a mental health history, stole two vehicles before being apprehended by police. The attack unfolded during busy shopping hours, causing widespread panic.
title: Texas shooting: 3 dead at Austin's Target store; gunman arrested

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan suggests selling Hindustan Zinc, citing a break of a flag pattern and downward trendline, targeting Rs 390. Conversely, L&T is a buy recommendation, as it broke a consolidation and resumed its uptrend, with a target of Rs 3800.
title: Top stocks to buy or sell: Stock market recommendations for today - check list

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Cristiano Ronaldo and Georgina Rodriguez have announced their engagement after eight years together, Rodriguez shared the news on Instagram, showcasing a diamond ring. Their relationship began in 2016, and they share a blended family, including five children. Rodriguez, a model and influencer, stars in her own Netflix series, 'I Am Georgina'. The engagement marks a significant milestone in their journey.
title: Who is Georgina Rodriguez? Cristiano Ronaldo’s fiancée after years together

author: TNN
description: A Vadodara woman filed a police report. She accused her father-in-law and sister-in-law's husband of repeated rape. The motive was to impregnate her due to her husband's low sperm count. She also accused her husband of blackmail after a miscarriage. The incidents occurred between February and July 2024. Police have registered a First Information Report and are investigating the case.
title: ‘Husband’s sperm count too low’: Father-in-law, relative rape Gujarat woman

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: HSBC recommends buying SBI shares, projecting a target price of Rs 960, citing strong Q1 performance and healthy loan growth prospects. UBS initiates coverage on HDB Financial with a neutral rating, forecasting mid-teen asset growth. Jefferies downgrades Tata Motors to 'underperform,' lowering the target price to Rs 550 due to Q1 misses and headwinds.
title: HDB Financial, SBI & more: Top stocks on brokers' radar today

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Cristiano Ronaldo, 40, and Georgina Rodriguez, 31, are engaged! Rodriguez revealed the stunning diamond ring, potentially worth up to $5 million, on Instagram. The couple, together since 2017 and parents to five children, met at a Gucci store. Jewelry experts estimate the flawless, brilliant-cut oval diamond could be as large as 30 carats, making it a truly remarkable piece.
title: How much Ronaldo’s engagement ring for Georgina really costs?

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: President Trump has extended the trade truce with China for 90 days, delaying tariff escalations and export controls. This extension aims to provide more time for Washington and Beijing to resolve trade disputes and potentially arrange a summit between Trump and Xi Jinping later this year. While negotiations continue, analysts remain cautious about the prospects for a final deal.
title: US extends China tariff truce by 90 days; Trump-Xi summit on cards?

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Cristiano Ronaldo and Georgina Rodriguez are now engaged. Georgina shared the news on Instagram. She posted a picture of a diamond ring. The couple met in 2016 in Madrid. They have built a close family together. They are raising two daughters. Ronaldo also has three other children. The couple had spoken about marriage in the past.
title: 'When we get that click': Ronaldo’s old words on marrying Georgina resurface after engagement - Watch

title: 4.7 lakh fake NCERT books seized in piracy crackdown: Govt

author: TNN
description: Robert Vadra, facing an Enforcement Directorate probe into land deals, has attributed key financial decisions to deceased associates, including Rajesh Khurana and H.L. Pahwa. This strategy mirrors responses from Sonia and Rahul Gandhi in the National Herald case, where they cited the late Motilal Vora's knowledge. The ED alleges Vadra was evasive and suppressed information regarding transactions.
title: ED faces 'wall of the dead' as Vadra puts burden on deceased colleagues

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Tom Brady refrained from picking the next Super Bowl-winning quarterback, despite being prompted about contenders like Josh Allen and Lamar Jackson. He emphasized that past accolades and MVP awards don't guarantee future success. Brady highlighted the importance of relentless preparation, leadership, and resilience, noting that championship journeys must be earned each season.
title: Tom Brady on Josh Allen & Lamar Jackson: ‘I don’t love predictions & hypothesizing’ about first Super Bowl win

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: With just days until its release, 'War 2', part of the YRF Spy Universe starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR, is generating significant pre-sales. The film has already sold over 1.26 lakh tickets, with advance sales reaching approximately Rs 4.1 crore, expected to rise further.
title: 'War 2': Hrithik Roshan & Jr NTR starrer sells 1.26 lakh ticketstouch Rs 8.50 crore

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Cristiano Ronaldo and Georgina Rodríguez are engaged, marking a significant step in their relationship. Georgina announced the news on Instagram, showcasing a dazzling ring. Their romance began in 2016 at a Gucci store in Madrid. They have since built a family, including daughters Alana Martina and Bella Esmeralda, with Georgina also raising Ronaldo's other children.
title: 'Yes, I do': Georgina Rodríguez confirms engagement to Cristiano Ronaldo

author: SACHIN PARASHAR
description: Amidst escalating efforts to resolve the Russia-Ukraine war, PM Modi and President Zelensky engaged in discussions, with Zelensky advocating for limitations on Russian energy exports. Modi reiterated India's commitment to a peaceful resolution and offered support for strengthening bilateral ties. Zelensky also expressed his desire to meet Modi in September at the UNGA sidelines in New York.
title: Zelensky dials PM Modi, seeks support ahead of Trump-Putin meet

author: TNN
description: In a troubling incident, the Gurgaon police have taken into custody Abhilash Kumar, a 32-year-old MTech graduate, for allegedly harassing a woman at Rajiv Chowk on August 2nd. The assistant manager, hailing from Karnal, was arrested in Sector 49 after a meticulous investigation that included reviewing CCTV footage.
title: Gurgaon techie who flashed woman arrested; was returning from son's PTM

author: MOHAMMED AKHEF
description: A security lapse at Beed district prison led to a violent clash among four undertrial prisoners after an unidentified person threw a rubber ball filled with ganja into the facility. The inmates fought over the distribution of the contraband, prompting jail staff intervention and a police investigation.
title: Weed behind bars: Ganja-filled ball thrown into Maharashtra jail

author: GAURAV TALWAR
description: Following the devastating flash flood in Dharali on August 5th, officials report 43 people still missing amidst warnings of more heavy rainfall in Uttarkashi until August 15th, potentially hindering search and relief efforts. A joint task force is navigating unstable terrain to find those trapped, while road repairs are underway despite weather challenges.
title: 43 people still missing in Uttarkashi flash floods, says govt in first official note

author: TNN
description: Home Minister Amit Shah lauded security forces for the secure and seamless Amarnath Yatra, which saw over 4.1 lakh pilgrims this year. This pilgrimage followed the Pahalgam attack and Operation Sindoor. Shah congratulated the security forces, the Shri Amarnathji Shrine Board, the J&K administration, and voluntary organizations for their commendable contributions to the successful pilgrimage.
title: Amit Shah praises security forces for conduct of smooth Amarnath Yatra

author: TNN
title: Muslims can end marriage by verbal mutual consent: Gujarat high court

author: GLOBAL SPORTS DESK
description: Trade rumors are swirling around Anaheim Ducks center Mason McTavish, with the Montreal Canadiens showing interest. Anaheim's GM Pat Verbeek is reportedly seeking a top-four, right-handed defenseman like Montreal's prospect David Reinbacher in exchange. This potential trade presents a dilemma for Montreal, weighing McTavish's immediate impact against Reinbacher's long-term value.
title: NHL Trade Rumors: Montreal Canadiens eye Mason McTavish, but Anaheim Ducks’ asking price for star center is steep

author: TNN
description: The family feud within the Sun TV Network, triggered by Dayanidhi Maran's accusations of fraud against Kalanithi Maran, has reportedly ended. Dayanidhi withdrew his legal notice following intervention by Tamil Nadu CM M K Stalin, who facilitated conciliatory talks between the brothers.
title: Sun TV shares case: Maran brothers bury the hatchet

author: DHANANJAY MAHAPATRA
description: The Supreme Court is examining the validity of Talaq-e-Hasan, a form of divorce where a Muslim man can divorce his wife by saying 'talaq' once a month for three months. The court has requested the NHRC, NCW, and NCPCR to provide their opinions on the matter. This comes after the SC previously outlawed triple talaq in 2017.
title: Supreme Court seeks three rights panels' views on Talaq-e-Hasan plea
